stlearn.tl.clustering.louvainÂ¶

stlearn.tl.clustering.louvain(adata: anndata._core.anndata.AnnData, resolution: Optional[float] = None, random_state: Union[int, numpy.random.mtrand.RandomState, None] = 0, restrict_to: Optional[Tuple[str, Sequence[str]]] = None, key_added: str = 'louvain', adjacency: Optional[scipy.sparse.base.spmatrix] = None, flavor: Literal[vtraag, igraph, rapids] = 'vtraag', directed: bool = True, use_weights: bool = False, partition_type: Optional[Type[louvain.VertexPartition.MutableVertexPartition]] = None, partition_kwargs: Mapping[str, Any] = mappingproxy({}), copy: bool = False) → Optional[anndata._core.anndata.AnnData]Â¶

Wrap function scanpy.tl.louvain Cluster cells into subgroups [Blondel08] [Levine15] [Traag17]. Cluster cells using the Louvain algorithm [Blondel08] in the implementation of [Traag17]. The Louvain algorithm has been proposed for single-cell analysis by [Levine15]. This requires having ran neighbors() or bbknn() first, or explicitly passing a adjacency matrix. :param adata: The annotated data matrix. :param resolution: For the default flavor ('vtraag'), you can provide a resolution

(higher resolution means finding more and smaller clusters), which defaults to 1.0. See âTime as a resolution parameterâ in [Lambiotte09].

Parameters

  • random_state â Change the initialization of the optimization.

  • restrict_to â Restrict the clustering to the categories within the key for sample annotation, tuple needs to contain (obs_key, list_of_categories).

  • key_added â Key under which to add the cluster labels. (default: 'louvain')

  • adjacency â Sparse adjacency matrix of the graph, defaults to adata.uns['neighbors']['connectivities'].

  • flavor â Choose between to packages for computing the clustering. 'vtraag' is much more powerful, and the default.

  • directed â Interpret the adjacency matrix as directed graph?

  • use_weights â Use weights from knn graph.

  • partition_type â Type of partition to use. Only a valid argument if flavor is 'vtraag'.

  • partition_kwargs â Key word arguments to pass to partitioning, if vtraag method is being used.

  • copy â Copy adata or modify it inplace.

Returns

  • None â By default (copy=False), updates adata with the following fields: adata.obs['louvain'] (pandas.Series, dtype category)

    Array of dim (number of samples) that stores the subgroup id ('0', '1', â¦) for each cell.

  • AnnData â When copy=True is set, a copy of adata with those fields is returned.
